message.content:
We start with the amount recorded in the Initial row for “Bank deposit” (from 2023‑12‑31) and then “adjust” that figure by subtracting all payments that used “Bank Transfer” (where money is paid “out‐of” the bank account). In our data the only rows that affect your bank deposit balance (aside from the initial posting) are Purchase transactions where the payment method is “Bank Transfer.” (Other items—those paid “Cash” or “Account Payable” etc.—do not adjust the bank–deposit account on the day of settlement.)

Step‑by‑step we do the following:

1. The “Initial20231231001” row with type “Bank deposit” shows an initial bank deposit balance of 5,000,000.00.

2. Next, we scan all Purchase rows (by their id) that used “Bank Transfer” as the payment_method. In our table these are (with amounts shown):

  • Purchase20231231001: 20,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231003: 20,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231005: 20,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231006: 60,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231007: 200,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231008: 300,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231009: 1,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231010: 10,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231012: 60,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231013: 3,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231014: 2,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231015: 10,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231016: 15,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231017: 100,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231018: 100,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231020: 20,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231023: 15,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231025: 100,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231026: 300,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231027: 60,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231028: 5,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231029: 200,000.00  
  • Purchase20231231030: 300,000.00

—All other purchases either used “Cash” or were “Unpaid/Account Payable” (meaning no bank–withdrawal happens at the time of the transaction).

3. Now we add up all the “Bank Transfer” amounts:
  20,000 + 20,000 + 20,000 + 60,000 + 200,000 + 300,000 + 1,000 + 10,000 + 60,000 + 3,000 + 2,000 + 10,000 + 15,000 + 100,000 + 100,000 + 20,000 + 15,000 + 100,000 + 300,000 + 60,000 + 5,000 + 200,000 + 300,000 = 1,921,000.00

4. The bank deposit “end value” is the initial bank deposit amount minus the total withdrawals done by bank transfers:
  5,000,000.00 – 1,921,000.00 = 3,079,000.00

Therefore, in our final answer we have:

{"solution": {'Bank Deposits Initial Value': '5000000.00', 'Bank Deposits End Value': '3079000.00'}}
